qas.question: What did the IPCC say was mistaken?
What did the IPCC apologize for?

answers.text: "the poor application of well-established IPCC procedures in this instance"
the poor application of well-established IPCC procedures
poor application of well-established IPCC procedures

qas.question: What was the source of the mistake?

answers.text: the IPCC from the WWF report

qas.question: What report had the correct date?

answers.text: "Variations of Snow and Ice in the past and at present on a Global and Regional Scale"
the IPCC from the WWF report

qas.question: Which date was affirmed by the IPCC?
What did policymakers create for the IPCC?
Who was given a projection included in the final summary?

plausible_answers.text: Variations of Snow and Ice in the past and at present on a Global and Regional Scale

qas.question: What was the name of the WWF report?

context: This projection was not included in the final summary for policymakers. The IPCC has since acknowledged that the date is incorrect, while reaffirming that the conclusion in the final summary was robust. They expressed regret for "the poor application of well-established IPCC procedures in this instance". The date of 2035 has been correctly quoted by the IPCC from the WWF report, which has misquoted its own source, an ICSI report "Variations of Snow and Ice in the past and at present on a Global and Regional Scale".
